decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development would, by&nbsp; reason of siting, scale, mass, bulk and design, would be an undesirable addition to the dwelling, excessively extending the ridge of the roof and adding&nbsp;volume to the roof.&nbsp;It therefore presents a very top-heavy development which would detract from the modest-scale of the <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lq3pmcqesb9h8m4su" style="">dwellinghouse</span> and uniformity and symmetry of the terrace row. It would also introduce a new incongruous feature to the front elevation. As such, it fails to respect and reflect the character of the original dwelling, terrace row and wider area, causing harm to each of these. It also fails to preserve or enhance the local distinctiveness of the <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lq3pmcx25zgjvaop8" style="">Becontree</span> Estate.&nbsp; &nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to: </p><ul><li style="">Paragraphs 126, 130, 134, and 203&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp; (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lq3pmd0ddii2bgmnl">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lq3pmd0c84yuki4zw">DLUHC</span>, September 2023) </li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;D4 and HC1&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021) </li><li style="">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </li><li style="">Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li style="">Paragraphs 5.4.1 and 5.4.2 of the&nbsp;Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012) </li><li style="">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
